p.s: Following I am going to analyze the given dialogue between Walter and his wife Ruth with focus on Walter's dream, his means to realize it and to the other family member'smembers' dreams.
The given dialogue plays in the beginning of the play A Raisin in the Sun and is about an argument between Ruth and Walter.
Before the given dialogue Walter and Ruth send her son Travis to school and after the given dialogue Beneatha wakes up and enterenters the living room.
In the beginning Walter talks about last night with his wife and he asks his wife if she wants to know about he was thinking in the bathroom (cf. l. 1ff.).
Ruth knows about Walter's dream, that he wants to invest the money of his mother in a liquor store.
The problem is that it is not Walter's money and that Ruth and Lena does not like the idea of a liquor store.
Another problem is that Ruth thinks that Willy Harris is a good-for-nothing loud mouth (l. 4).

Walter tries to convince his wife while saying: Charlie Atkins was just a good-for-nothing loud mouth' too, wasn't he!When he wanted me to go in the dry-cleaning business with him.And now he's grossing a hundred thousand a year.A hundred thousand dollar a year!You still call him a loud mouth! (l. 6ff.) He wants to show his wife that not everyone of his friends is a good-for-nothing loud mouth.
Following Walter ignores his wife because she wants to end the discussion with her husband.
Walter wants to realize his dream while trying to convince that Ruth has to talk to his mother and talk about the business idea because Ruth has a better relationship with his mother.
He shows her how to do it.
They only have to drink some coffee and Ruth only havehas to say that she is so interested in the deaddeath of her husband and in the store (cf. ll. 18-25).
After that Walter says with who he wants to work with and Ruth does not like the people (cf. l. 25f.).
Walter says that the liquor store costcosts seventy five thousand dollar but the profit will be about thirty thousand dollar.
To compare his dream to the other family members' dreams his dream costs more money thenthan for example the dream of Ruth and Lena.
The dream of Ruth and Lena is that they want better living conditions and a small house with a small garden in another and a better neighbourhood.
The dream of Travis, the son of Walter and Ruth is also cheaper than the dream of Walter.
His dream are better living conditions in his term for example an own room for him and probably no money issues anymore.
Beneatha's dream is becoming a doctor and this is more expensive than Walter's dream.
All in all is Walter's dream one of the expensivests dreams of the family and the riskiest.
The money of the dead husband is not enough to realize every dream.
Walter wants to realize his dream while bribing other people.
Ruth does not like that her husband wantwants to graft and it is illegal.
Walterplayplays it down in a way that he can't get a bad feeling of what he wants to do (cf. l. 31ff.).
Ruth shows her rage while saying: Walter, leave me alone!Eat your eggs, they gonna be cold (l. 34).
Walter does not like the mindset of his wife and tries to replay the argument of them (cf. ll. 35-38).
Ruth tries to wake up Walter out of his thoughts and says that it is not his money (cf. l. 39).

Walter does not heed to his wife and goes on and givegives back his life which is sometimes of none happiness like in l. 42: Very, very quietly - and all I got to give him is stories about how rich white people live ....
This sentence is a big contrast to how Walter in the other parts talk.
It shows that he is not happy with his situation and that he wants to change something especially for his son Travis.
Ruth is in this dialogue the person who stays realistic and she wants to hold on her husband because she thinks that they are bad for him.
She shows that in for example (with a frawn) (l. 26) or (bitterly) (l. 10).
In conclusion is Walter's dream not to realize because it is not his money about he talks and plays and his wife does not like his business idea and the friends of him with Walter wants to work with.
The opinion of Ruth does not change in the dialogue because firstly Walter ignores her all the time and secondly she does not like the package.
